physicalDescription.extent: The file’s contents are arranged in chronological order, from the earliest item at the front to the latest at the end. The file notes at the end of the file (f 5) mirror the chronological arrangement.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover on folio 1 and terminates at the back cover on folio 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of a letter (f 1) from B S Bridge of British Overseas Airways Corporation (BOAC), to the Political Agent at Bahrain, dated 18 March 1947, requesting whether the prohibited area west of a line joining Manama, Jufair and Sitra, which was in force during the war, is still in force. Bridge makes the request because current prevailing winds necessitate the crossing of the line by aircraft.The reply (ff 2-3) from the Political Agent, Cornelius James Pelly, dated 29 March 1947, states that the only information in his office regarding the prohibited zone is from a letter from the Station Superintendent for BOAC, dated 11 December 1940, confirming the location of the prohibition area, of which he encloses an extract. No indication is made as to whether the line marking the prohibited area is still in force or not.
